details.description: Rather than providing feedback as a written document, comments are provided to the student in the form of an audio or video commentary. Video has the advantage of allowing the tutor to indicate (point to) the area of work being discussed, as well as being able to illustrate the feedback with drawn graphics.
details.applicability: Useful for complex feedback, that makes the overhead of setting up the recording and distribution of feedback worthwhile.
details.consequences: May cause additional work in setting up recording and distributing media.
